intro: Onosma elegans var. gundelsheimeri, commonly known as the Gundelsheim onosma, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It has small, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
